

h1. Manage Tasks



h1. Add a Task

eXo Calendar allows you to add a new task by following simple steps:

*Step 1\.* Open the *Add task* dialog by three ways:
+The 1^st^ way+: Click the *Task* icon for quick add task or the *Add Task* icon for detail add task on the tool bar.


!AddTask-topnav.png!


+The 2^nd^ way+:  Create a task directly by right clicking on on the calendar view panel and selecting the *Add new task* in the drop down list menu:


!AddNewTask.gif!


+The 3^rd^ way+:  Create an event directly at the calendars selector level by right clicking on the calendar name and selecting the *Add Task* in the menu:


!AddTask.gif!


The *Quick add task* dialog will appear:



!QuickAddTaskForm.gif!




|| Name || Description ||
| Task | The name of the task. |
| Description | The detail description of the task. |
| From | The start date/time of the task. |
| To | The end date/time of the task. |
| All day | All day option allows setting the duration of the task to be all day or not. If you don't check this option, you have to select the start date/time and end date/time. By default, the start date and end date is the current date. |
| Calendar | The calendar will include the task. |
| Task category | The category will include the task. |
| Save button | To accept saving a new task. |
| More details | To show the event in more details that allows defining more properties for the task. |
| Cancel button | To exit the *Add task* form without adding new. |

When the *More details* button is clicked or add a new task by clicking the *Add detail task* button in the menu bar, the *Add detail task* dialog is displayed with two tabs (Detail and Reminders) which allows defining a task in more details:


!TaskForm.gif!


The *Detail* tab allows defining detail task information.



|| Name || Description ||
| Task name | The name of the task. |
| Note | The notice or description of the task |
| Task delegations | The user(s) to whom you would like to delegate the task. You can manually input or click the
!icon.gif!
   icon to select a user from the *Group Selector* dialog. |




!GroupSelector.gif!



|| Name || Description ||
| From | The start date/time of a task |
| To | The end date/time of a task |
| All day | This option allows whether setting a task to be all day or not. |
| Priority | The priority level of the task. |
| Calendar | The calendar will include the task. |
| Task Category | The category will include the task that can be selected from the existing tasks or added a new one by clicking the
!icon.gif!
    icon to open the *Event categories* dialog: |



!EventCategories.gif!


To add a new category, input *Event category* and *Description* in form and complete adding a new category by clicking the *Save* button. A new category is immediately displayed in the Task category selector.

Task status: The status of a task. This field can be set to: Need action, In process, Completed or Canceled.

The *Attach file* button: To attach files to the task. The attachment may be a spreadsheet or a presentation needed for a task. To attach a file, clicking the *Attach file* button, the *Attach files* dialog will appear and files can be attached or removed like when attaching a file to an event.


The *Reminders* tab: The reminder function is used to remind users who will take part in the task. A reminder includes summary information about the task such as title, time, place where the task will happen...


!ReminderForm.gif!


*Reminder by mail:*


|| Name || Description ||
| When task starts in next | The time when the mail reminder is sent before the event starts. |
| Repeat | Repeat option allows setting reminder repeat or not for an event. |
| every | The interval time (in every xxx minutes) the reminder will be repeated before the task starts. |
| Send reminders to | List of email addresses to which the mail reminder will be sent. Default value is the email address of current user. You can manually input email address list or select from the *Select email* form by clicking on the
!icon.gif!
   icon. |



!SelectEmail.gif!


- Email addresses are available in a list and can be selected by selecting its check box(s).
- The *Group* and *Search* function allow filtering and searching the expected mail result..
- Click the *Add* button to add the selected emails to the *Send reminder to* field or click the *Replace* button to replace the existing emails by the selected emails or click the *Cancel* button to close this form.

After adding email addresses, the email addresses of the selected contacts are displayed in the *Send reminders to* field of the *Reminders* tab.
When Remind by email function is used, the notification email about the task will be sent at the time like its definition.

*Show a notification pop up:*

|| Name || Description ||
| When event/task starts in next | The time you will receive a pop up reminder before the task starts. |
| Repeat | Repeat option allows setting the task's pop up reminder repeat or not. |
| every | The interval time (in every xxx minutes) the pop up reminder will be repeated before the task starts. |


When *Show a notification popup* is used, the notification pop up about the task will appear when using eXo Calendar at the time like its definition.

*Step 2.* Fill values to the required fields.

*Step 3.* Complete adding a new task by clicking the *Save* button. The added task will be displayed when viewing a calendar in which it is stored.














h1. View a Task

To view a detail task of a calendar, right click on the task in the Calendar View Panel and select *View* item in menu:


!view.gif!


The *Preview* form will be displayed:


!preview.gif!


In the preview form, if the task includes attachments, you can view image attachment by clicking (+) view icon or download any attachment by directly clicking on the attachment's title, a pop up will be displayed, available for saving the attachment file into local disk.




h1. Edit a Task

This function allows making changes to the existing tasks. To edit a task, do as follows:

*Step 1\.* Right clicking on the task you want to edit and select *edit* in the menu.


!edit.gif!


The *Tasks* form will be displayed and full- filled with all task information, available for editing:


!Tasks.gif!


*Step 2.* Modify information of the selected task by following the steps as you create a new task.

*Step 3.* Complete editing by clicking the *Save* button.

{info}
*Note:*
- When editing you can add, remove the attachment files or download them by directly clicking on the titles
- If you only want to change the start date and time of the task, you can also use drag and drop feature to edit the time for the task directly on the Calendar view panel.
- You can only edit tasks in personal, shared and group calendars which you have edit permission.
{info}





h1. Delete a Task

This function allows removing a task from a calendar. Follow these simple guides to delete a task:

+The 1^st^ way+:

*Step 1\.* Right click on the task you want to delete and then select the *Delete* item in menu:


!delete.gif!


The confirmation message will appear:


!confirm.gif!


*Step 2.* Complete deleting by clicking *OK* button in the confirmation message.

+The 2^nd^ way+:

*Step 1\.* In Month view and List view, it possible to select the check box in front of the task name and then click the
!deletechecked.gif!
     button in the action bar.

*Step 2.* The *Confirmation message* will appear. Click *OK* button to accept deleting the selected task or click *Cancel* button to quit without deleting a task.
{info}
*Note:* You can only delete tasks in personal, shared and group calendars which you have edit permission.
{info}




h1. Drag and Drop a Task

Similarly to drag and drop event, Drag and drop is a nice feature to change the start date and time of a task. Just clicking on the task, drag and drop it on the new day, new time area in Calendar view panel.

To change task duration (in day view, week view and working view only), use your mouse and the control at the bottom of the event. According to Calendar panel view's features, drag and drop feature can be applied to the date and time differently.

In Day view, all events are shown in 1 day, you can change the task time in one day only.
In Week and Work Week view, all events are shown in 1 week, you can change both the task time and the task date.
In Month view, all events are shown in 1 moth, you can can change the task date only. You can also change more tasks at same time by ticking on their check boxes and using drag and drop feature.
{info}
*Note :*You can only drag and drop tasks in personal, shared and group calendars which you have edit permission. For example, if you drag and drop the task which you do not have edit permission, a warning message shows that: 'You are not allow to edit this event/task'.
{info}


h1. Export a Task


You can export one task to a separate file on your computer by following guides:


*Step 1\.* Right click on the task that you want to export and select *Export* in menu:


!export.gif!


# dialog to export a task will appear:


!ExportCalendarsForm.gif!


*Step 2.* Enter a file name to export.

*Step 3.* Click the *Save* button to accept exporting the task. A pop up will appear:


!OpeningCalendar.gif!


*Step 4.* Click the *OK* button to save the exported file into your local disk.

{info}
*Note:* In fact, exporting a task means exporting a calendar with one task only. Therefore, the exported file format and the way
to export a task is similar with the way to export a calendar with multiple events and tasks.
{info}


h1. Import a Task

This function allows importing a task into the specific calendar. In fact, importing a task means importing a calendar with one task only. There fore, the way to import a task is similar to the way to import a calendar.

You can see *Import Calendars* in [Manage Calendars] for more details.
